title: Simplify Both Sides
text: We want to start by simplifying both sides and comparing the simplified value. Since the left hand side is already simplified, all we need to do is to evaluate the right hand side.
speech: We want to start by simplifying both sides and comparing the simplified value. Since the left hand side is already simplified, all we need to do is to evaluate the right hand side.
pacedSpeech: We want to start by simplifying both sides and comparing the simplified value. Since the left hand side is already simplified, all we need to do is to evaluate the right hand side.

title: Right Hand Side

subHints.title: Right Hand Side
subHints.text: The absolute value of a number is its distance from $$0$$ on the number line. Distance is never negative, so the absolute value is never negative.

speech: What does , the absolute value of negative 8, end absolute value  evaluate to?
pacedSpeech: What does  , the absolute value of negative 8, end absolute value

title: Comparing Numbers
text: Now we are left to compare $$-8$$ and $$8$$. Since $$-8$$ is to the left of $$8$$ on the number line, we say $$-8<8$$. Therefore, $$-8<|-8|$$.
speech: Now we are left to compare  minus 8  and  8 . Since  negative 8  is to the left of  8  on the number line, we say  negative 8 is less than, 8 . Therefore,  negative 8, is less than, the absolute value of negative 8, end absolute value .
